intro: Scorzonera crispatula var. corbariensis, commonly known as the Corbari scurvygrass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. This variety is notable for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators and its historical use in traditional herbal medicine.
